messages.message:
I exchanged some emails/texts with the CapOne team and was able to fully flesh out what they're looking to do with their real time validation use case.  This is just phase one of the project, and from what I've gathered it ideally needs to be in by January of 2022:

1. An authentication document is requested of a User
2. User uploads the document through Courier, C1's web portal (government issued ID, SS4 letter, bank statement)
3. Courier calls Instabase via API with that single document (or document packet, in the case of multiple bank statements)
4. Instabase ONLY classifies the document (eg "is this a drivers license?")
5. Based on classification validation, call sent back to Courier with one of two actions:
6a. Document matches what is expected, User may continue
6b. Information is incorrect or unexpected, User prompted to correct

More discovery is needed, but wanted to close the loop on at least the initial use-case scope.
Do they have a time requirement, like the API needs to return in X seconds?

Negative, I asked about time to response and they said that they didn't have any sort of metric around that.  The only thing they told me was that in the context of user experience, it "needs to feel snappy"
